title: Snow, road damage cause spinouts, closures on Highway 50, I-80
text:
February 21, 2017 10:00 AM Snow, road damage cause spinouts, closures on Highway 50, I-80 See the water-saturated Sacramento River area from the sky 1:57 Lt. Gov. Gavin Newsom says spillway failure a wake-up call 1:31 Kevin de Le√≥n: California won't 'regress back to the politics of scapegoating' 4:54 Kings GM Divac says Kings fans 'deserve better' while discussing Cousins trade 2:03 Storm forecast includes flooding and wind gusts 1:39 Get a glimpse of the damage to Oroville Dam's main spillway after several days of running at 100,000 cubic feet per second 1:26 Oroville Dam's main spillway 'stable' but eroded as officials adjust flow rate 1:24 Water rescue at Arcade Creek 0:32 Don Pedro spillway water flows over road Share Video email Traffic controls were in place at Donner Summit on Tuesday, Feb. 21, 2017, as heavy snow caused CHP to stop vehicles and turn them back while Caltrans crews tried to clear Interstate 80 of the heavy, wet snow that has been piling up through the latest set of storms. California Highway Patrol - Truckee Damage to the westbound lanes of Highway 50 near Bridal Veil Falls continues to deteriorate. California Highway Patrol Damage shown to Highway 50 near Bridal Veil falls. California Highway Patrol 1 of 3 i 
By Bill Lindelof 
Damage to the westbound lanes of Highway 50 near Bridal Veil Falls continues to deteriorate and hazardous driving conditions have closed Interstate 80, the California Highway Patrol reports. 
The state Department of Transportation is reducing eastbound traffic to one lane to allow westbound traffic to continue, according to the CHP. 
Earlier, it was reported that a shoulder along westbound Highway 50 east of Bridal Veil Falls collapsed and the slow lane is buckling. 
Along I-80 in the mountains, eastbound traffic was being held near Castle Peak due to multiple spinouts on snowy roads. All westbound traffic was being turned around at the state line due to lack of road traction. And traction issues also prompted trucks to be turned around at Applegate in the eastbound direction of the freeway. 
Meanwhile, chains are required Tuesday morning on Interstate 80 and Highway 50 in the Sierra. 
Highway 89 at the west shore of Emerald Bay is closed for avalanche concerns, Caltrans reports.
